contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Tsutsuga'''|筒賀村|Tsutsuga-son}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Yamagata District, Hiroshima|Yamagata District]], [[Hiroshima Prefecture|Hiroshima]], [[Japan]]. On October 1, 2004 Tsutsuga was merged with the towns of [[Kake, Hiroshima|Kake]] and [[Togouchi, Hiroshima|Togouchi]], all from [[Yamagata District, Hiroshima|Yamagata District]], to form the new town of [[Akiōta, Hiroshima|Akiōta]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 1,193 and a [[population density|density]] of 22.06 persons per km². The total area was 54.07 km². ==External links== * [http://www.akiota.jp/ Official website of Akiōta] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hiroshima Prefecture]] {{Hiroshima-geo-stub}}
